tit.cmt: Boan SHIMOZU と修正しました。（用語集とは異なりますが、ウェブ上では確認できないのと、下述の”下津宗秀”との兼ね合いもあり）

sen.j: 下津俸庵（しもづ ぼうあん、元亀元年（1570年） - 寛永8年5月19日 (旧暦)（1631年6月18日））は江戸時代前期の武士。
sen.e: SHIMOZU Bouan (1570 - June 18, 1631) was a samurai in the early Edo period.
Boan SHIMOZU (1570 - June 18, 1631) was a samurai in the early Edo period.
sen.cmt: Boan SHIMOZU と修正しました。
sen.e: Boan SHIMOZU (1570 - June 18, 1631) was a samurai in the early Edo period.
He was the third son of Michikata KOGA, a Court noble.
He was the third son of Michikata KOGA, a court noble.
He was the third son of Michikata KOGA, a court noble.

sen.j: 別名は久我祖秀、下津宗秀。
sen.e: He was also named KOGA 祖秀 or SHIMOZU Munehide.
He was also named 祖秀 KOGA or Munehide SHIMOZU.
sen.cmt: 祖秀 KOGA と修正、 SHIMOZU Munehide→Munehide SHIMOZU と修正しました。「祖秀」の読みは確認できておりません。
sen.e: He was also named 祖秀 KOGA or Munehide SHIMOZU.
He was commonly called Shogen or Bouan.
He was commonly called Shogen or Boan.
sen.cmt: スペースの修正、Bouan→Boan と修正しました。
sen.e: He was commonly called Shogen or Boan.

sen.j: もともとは鹿苑寺の住職であった。
sen.e: He was originally the chief priest of Rokuon-ji Temle.
He was originally the chief priest of Rokuon-ji Temple.
He was originally the chief priest of Rokuon-ji Temple.

sen.j: しかし、武芸を好み、還俗し、下津俸庵と称した。
sen.e: However he liked military arts and returned to secular life to be called SHIMOZU Bouan.
However he liked military arts and returned to secular life to be called Boan SHIMOZU.
sen.cmt: Boan SHIMOZU と修正しました。
sen.e: However he liked military arts and returned to secular life to be called Boan SHIMOZU.

sen.j: 肥後国熊本城主加藤清正に仕え、3000石を与えられた。
sen.e: He served Kiyomasa KATO, the lord of Kumamoto Castle in Higo Province, and was granted 3000 goku of rice.
He served Kiyomasa KATO, the castellan of Kumamoto-jo Castle in Higo Province, and was granted 3,000 koku.
sen.cmt: lord→castellan,Kumamoto Castle→Kumamoto-jo Castle,goku of rice→koku,3000→3,000 と修正しました。
sen.e: He served Kiyomasa KATO, the castellan of Kumamoto-jo Castle in Higo Province, and was granted 3,000 koku.

sen.j: 寛永8年（1631年）5月19日死去、享年62。
sen.e: He died on May 19, 1631 at the age of 62.
He died on May 19, 1631 at the age of 62.
He died on May 19, 1631 at the age of 62.

sen.j: 長男下津宗正は加藤家の改易により、細川氏に仕えることになった。
sen.e: His first son, Munemasa SHIMOZU, served the Hosokawa clan, as the result of Kaieki (forfeit rank of Samurai and properties) of Kato family.
His first son, Munemasa SHIMOZU, came to serve the Hosokawa clan, as the result of Kaieki (change of rank) of the Kato family.
sen.cmt: served→came to serve,カッコ部分を修正しました。the を挿入しました。
sen.e: His first son, Munemasa SHIMOZU, came to serve the Hosokawa clan, as the result of Kaieki (change of rank) of the Kato family.

sen.j: 次男亀谷通尹は朝廷に出仕した。
sen.e: His second son, 亀谷通尹, served Imperial Court.
His second son, 亀谷通尹, served the Imperial Court.
sen.cmt: the を挿入しました。「亀谷通尹」の読みは確認できておりません。
sen.e: His second son, 亀谷通尹, served the Imperial Court.

sen.j: 三男東久世通廉（異説もある）も朝廷に出仕した。
sen.e: His third son, Michitsumu HIGASHIKUZE (although some have different opinion), also served Imperial Court.
His third son, Michikado HIGASHIKUZE (although some have different opinion), also served the Imperial Court.
sen.cmt: 「東久世通廉」は、用語集のものとは異なり、”ひがしくぜみちかど”で確認しました。the を挿入しました。
sen.e: His third son, Michikado HIGASHIKUZE (although some have different opinion), also served the Imperial Court.
